name: Sahara Desert
hint: Largest hot desert on Earth, covering most of North Africa across eleven countries

name: Kalahari Desert
hint: Large semi-arid sandy savanna spanning Botswana, Namibia, and South Africa

name: Namib Desert
hint: Considered the oldest desert in the world, famous for Sossusvlei's red sand dunes

name: Karoo
hint: Semi-desert region in South Africa known for its fossil-rich geology and vast open spaces

name: Danakil Desert
hint: One of the hottest places on Earth, in Ethiopia with lava lakes and salt flats

name: Libyan Desert
hint: Part of the Sahara spanning Libya, Egypt, and Sudan with vast sand seas

name: Chalbi Desert
hint: Small but harsh desert in northern Kenya near Lake Turkana

name: Tenere Desert
hint: Vast sand sea in the south-central Sahara in Niger, once home to a famous lone tree

name: Nubian Desert
hint: Eastern section of the Sahara in northeastern Sudan between the Nile and the Red Sea

name: Grand Erg Oriental
hint: Massive sand dune field in the northern Sahara spanning Algeria and Tunisia
